entry.title: Youtube skill Bugs
entry.summary: Since the project was launched we have had tones of issue requests due to Api usage. Today I am happy to announce that we will be moving away from the YouTube Api to an unofficial one. This will remove the Api usage errors completely. We…
entry.content:
Since the project was launched we have had tones of issue requests due to Api usage. Today I am happy to announce that we will be moving away from the YouTube Api to an unofficial one. This will remove the Api usage errors completely. We will also be launching some public servers at the same time to make the setup process even easier.

 These changes will happen slowly across the next few weeks.

entry.title: YouTube Alexa edition Broken
entry.summary: Hello everyone unfortunately as of the 1st of June the skill is broken. This is due to the skill no longer being able to see the status of urls. Have a look at the status page for updates. https://skills-status.andrewstech.me/
entry.content:
Hello everyone unfortunately as of the 1st of June the skill is broken. This is due to the skill no longer being able to see the status of urls.

Have a look at the status page for updates. https://skills-status.andrewstech.me/

entry.title: YouTube alexa edition setup
entry.summary: So you want to have YouTube on alexa? Video If so lets get started. First off you need to setup a free Heroku account. You can do this by clicking here. Once we have created our Heroku account we need to deploy our code to…
entry.content:
So you want to have YouTube on alexa?

Video



If so lets get started. First off you need to setup a free Heroku account. You can do this by clicking here. Once we have created our Heroku account we need to deploy our code to it. Don't worry this is easy. Click the deploy to Heroku button.
Once on the page enter an app name. This can be anything you like, Once entered press deploy and wait for the app to install. After the app is installed click on the view button. This will take you to your app and will display a 404 error.

If you see this then your app is working. Take a note of your URL as you will need this later.

We now need an Api key from YouTube. We start by creating a project click here to create.
Choose a project name (this can be anything, I called mine potato-267419). Once created make sure you have your new project selected and head to the api console.

 When your on the api console search for YouTube data api v3. Enable it and click the Create Credentials. Choose the following options stated in the image bellow.

Click the what credentials do I need button. It will then give you an api key, place this in your notes.
 Now we make the skill.  You now need a Voiceflow account. Click here to create one.

 Now you have a Voiceflow account head to https://download.andrewstech.me/youtube-skill-v3

 This should add the code to your account. As you may notice this is all drag and drop for this skill this
will help everyone to maintain the skill or add new functions. Please note that voiceflow is free and I highly
recommend them.
The two blocks that I have highlighted are where you api key and heroku link need to go. To edit them click on
their block and you should see the text "YOUR API HERE" replace this with the YouTube api key you were given.
In the next block you should see "YOUR LINK HERE" replace that with your heroku link.


Now you have done that Click on the settings cog at the top and change your Invocation name to that you want to use to launch the skill.
Once you have done that click upload to alexa and a button will appear saying connect amazon. CLICK IT.
and sign in to your amazon account. Once your account has been linked press the button again.

 That is it the skill should now be available on your amazon echo.

 Hope it works if not send me a DM or leave a comment bellow.

 Please list any issues with the project on GitHub: https://github.com/andrewstech/youtube-alexa-edition/issues

 If you would like to support this project then feel free to donate here

The status of the skill can be found here: https://skills-status.andrewstech.me/

entry.title: YouTube Alexa Edition - Auto Screen Detection Broken
entry.summary: As of a few days ago the youtube alexa skill no longer detected if devices had a screen or not. I have developed a small fix. Download this version by clicking here Set the variable Circled above to yes if your device has a screen…
entry.content:
As of a few days ago the youtube alexa skill no longer detected if devices had a screen or not. I have developed a small fix.

Download this version by clicking here

Set the variable Circled above to yes if your device has a screen or no if it does not.

Remember to enter your api and your dl link in the boxes.

This Should act as temporary fix for this issue.

entry.title: YouTube skill V3 update
entry.summary: The YouTube skill has received a new update which fixes many of the bugs that have been reported. The setup is the same but the fuction of the skill has been made so much more stable. The skill now has more than 2176 users.
entry.content: The YouTube skill has received a new update which fixes many of the bugs that have been reported. The setup is the same but the fuction of the skill has been made so much more stable. The skill now has more than 2176 users.

entry.title: YouTube Skill V3
entry.summary: The new YouTube V3 skill by andrewstech has been released to the world for everyone to enjoy. The skill features both audio and video playback. The skill will not be released to the alexa skill store but instead you will have to build it yourself.
entry.content:
The new YouTube V3 skill by andrewstech has been released to the world for everyone to enjoy. The skill features both audio and video playback. The skill will not be released to the alexa skill store but instead you will have to build it yourself. The skill is easily put together, and requires no credit card as we are not using aws. For the instructions click here. 

Video released on Saturday 11th of April 2020 at 10:00 GMT
